other_tests.findings: Confirmed the infarcts and hemorrhagic conversion seen on prior imaging; cortical vein not visible over the lesion suggestive of cortical-vein throm-bosis.
Showed multiple cerebral venous throm-boses involving right frontal and parietal cortical veins, with no involvement of major dural sinuses.
Normocellular for age, showed evidence of maturing tri-lineage hematopoiesis with no morphologic or genetic evidence of myelodysplastic syndrome.

Revealed abnormal loss of GPI-anchored proteins, 1% of glycophorin A+ erythrocytes had partial CD59 deficiency and 5% had complete deficiency; approximately 57% of CD15+ neutrophils showed loss of CD24 expression; 60% of CD64+ monocytes showed loss of CD14 expression.
